meanings.definition: A substance or treatment used to protect clothing from damage by moths.
meanings.sent1: I sprayed mothproofer on my favorite sweater to keep it safe from hungry moths.
meanings.sent2: The mothproofer worked wonders in preserving my wool coat from moth damage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous moths tried to nibble on my clothes, but the mothproofer scared them away!
meanings.sent4: Her closet was a fortress, each garment shielded by a layer of mothproofer.
meanings.sent5: With a swift spray of mothproofer, the delicate fabrics were shielded from harm.

meanings.definition: A person or company that specializes in applying mothproofing treatments.
meanings.sent1: The mothproofer arrived promptly to treat all the clothes in the wardrobe.
meanings.sent2: My aunt hired a professional mothproofer to safeguard her vintage clothing collection.
meanings.sent3: The mothproofer had a magical touch, turning ordinary clothes into moth-repelling wonders.
meanings.sent4: She was like a superhero, swooping in as the mothproofer to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The mothproofer's expertise was unmatched, ensuring every garment was moth-resistant.

meanings.definition: To treat or protect clothing with a mothproofing substance.
meanings.sent1: I need to mothproofer my winter coats before storing them for the season.
meanings.sent2: She carefully mothproofed her cashmere scarf to prevent any moth damage.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer decided to mothproofer all the new garments for extra protection.
meanings.sent4: As the seasons changed, it was time to mothproofer the summer clothes for storage.
meanings.sent5: He diligently mothproofed each piece of clothing, ensuring they would last for years to come.
